snippet: The report was seen as a glint of coming wage gains, which so far in the recovery have been no better than tepid. Also, the four-week average of initial jobless claims fell to a level not seen since 2006.
abstract: Labor Department reports that its Employment Cost Index rose 0.7 percent in the second quarter, the biggest gain in more than five and a half years; also reports that four-week average of initial claims for unemployment benefits fell 3,500 to a seasonally adjusted 297,250.
lead_paragraph: The report was seen as a glint of coming wage gains, which so far in the recovery have been no better than tepid. Also, the four-week average of initial jobless claims fell to a level not seen since 2006.

headline.main: Labor Costs Climbed 0.7% In Quarter, a Sign of Health
headline.print_headline: Labor Costs Climbed 0.7% in Quarter, a Sign of Health
